author: Tom Sykes
title: Super Lovely Planet swaps first- for third-person platforming | PC Gamer
text:
The third in the Lovely series, out this Summer. Shares 
Lovely Planet Arcade, the sequel to colourful first-person platformer Lovely Planet, did things a little differently to its forbear: it ditched the y-axis, and made it so that projectiles worked via the instantaneous 'hitscan' method rather than via slowly moving physical missiles. It seemed to be taking things back to the days of Doom, when you didn't have to worry about looking up or down: a source of much anxiety in this modern, multi-level world of ours. 
For the just-announced third entry in the Lovely series, some even bigger changes are a-foot. Super Lovely Planet , out this Summer, swaps first-person platforming for third-person leaping and bounding; it also changes the protagonist from someone with arms and a gun to...a big yellow ball. Well alright then. Here's what that looks like, by the way: 
According to the official site, Super will be the last game set on Lovely Planet, and it will be just as systemically pure as the previous titles, boasting no other powers than the humble jump button. It will also feature NPCs, allow you to revisit "iconic" locations from previous Lovelies, and kill you lots and lots. I do enjoy a good 3D platformer, and I'm glad to see Super Lovely Planet join the ranks of Poi, Yooka-Laylee, and A Hat in Timeâ€”man, 2017 is the year of the 3D platformer, isn't it? 
SLP isn't out till the Summer, but there's a pre-emptive Steam page if you'd like to add it to your wishlist. (Ta, RPS .) Topics
